content.title: Sympathetic Assistance and Handholding for Youth Transformation and Amelioration - SAHAYTA
content.department: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
content.details: The scheme 'Sympathetic Assistance And Handholding For Youth Transformation And Amelioration' is a Jammu and Kashmir initiative with the aim to provide financial assistance to youth in distress for setting up gainful self-employment ventures.
benefits: The total amount of self employment assistance provided shall be ₹2,00,000/- or the actual cost of self employment unit, which is lower.
The amount of ₹2,00,000/- has to be compulsorily utilized for self employment generation.
If the total project cost exceeds ₹2,00,000/-, the excess amount shall be self financed by the applicant.
eligibility: Applicant must be between 18 to 40 age group.
Applicant lost a family member or been permanently incapacitated in an insurgency-related incident, cross-border shelling, or mine blast in Jammu and Kashmir.
Permanent incapacitation is defined as a disability of 50% or more that is permanent and has no chance of improvement.
People involved in anti-national activities, directly or indirectly, and their family members are not eligible.
content.application_process: Offline. Applicant can file their claims in a prescribed form along with the required documents within two years of the incident to the concerned Deputy Commissioner.
documents_required: Certificate regarding non-involvement in militancy/anti-national activities from the concerned SDPO.
Death cum Post Mortem Certificate (if applicable).
Medical Certificate (in case of incapacitation of 50% and above).
Any proof showing relationship of the beneficiary with the victim (Not required if victim is the claimant).
Project report/details about the self-employment unit to be set up by the applicant.
Undertaking/NOC from other family members that they have no objection of the benefit under the scheme is given to the applicant.

faqs.question: What is SAHAYTA scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme 'Sympathetic Assistance And Handholding For Youth Transformation And Amelioration' is a Jammu and Kashmir initiative with the aim of financial assistance.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided under the scheme?
How much financial benefits are provided?
faqs.answer: The total amount of self employment assistance provided shall be ₹2,00,000/- or the actual cost of self employment unit, which is lower.

faqs.question: Can a beneficiary get the scheme benefits multiple times?
faqs.answer: No, Scheme benefits will be provided only at once.

faqs.question: What is the age eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Applicant must be between 18 to 40 age group.

faqs.question: Can a person from another state also avail the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, Applicant must be domicile of Jammu and Kashmir.

faqs.question: What is the eligible criteria for the disabled person?
faqs.answer: This is defined as a disability of 50% or more that is permanent and has no chance of improvement.

faqs.question: How to get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Applicant can file their claims in a prescribed form along with the required documents within two years of the incident to the concerned Deputy Commissioner.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: 1. Certificate regarding non-involvement in militancy/anti-national activities from the concerned SDPO. 2. Death cum Post Mortem Certificate (if applicable). 3. Medical Certificate (in case of incapacitation of 50% and above). 4. Any proof showing relationship of the beneficiary with the victim (Not required if victim is the claimant). 5. Date of Birth Certificate. 6. Unemployment certificate from Employment Department. 7. Project report/details about the self-employment unit to be set up by the applicant. 8. Undertaking/NOC from other family members that they have no objection of the benefit under the scheme is given to the applicant.
